sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"荫，荫凉处"之意。
means: shade ： 指阳光被遮挡后出现的荫凉处，如树荫等，无一定的轮廓或边界。
shadow ： 常指光线被物体挡住所产生的阴影，影子，有明显的轮廓。

word_mean: 影：客观存在的物体的一种变淡影像，如褪色或无色的红细胞
阴影，影像：光线或其他射线受阻后形成的物体图像或影像，如不透射线的组织在X光胶片上出现的影像

sentence.Network_en: It was without a shadow of a doubt the best we've played.
sentence.Network_cn: 毫无疑问这是我们表现最出彩的一次。

sentence.Network_en: The light from my candle threw his elongated shadow on the walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的烛光将他拉长的影子投射在墙上。

sentence.Network_en: Nothing would grow in the shadow of the grey wall.
sentence.Network_cn: 灰墙的背阴处什么东西也长不出来。

jx.jx_cn_mean: （因过度劳累）使自己精疲力竭

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English scead(u)we (noun), oblique case of sceadu (see shade), sceadwian 'screen or shield from attack', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schaduw and German Schatten (nouns), from an Indo-European root shared by Greek skotos 'darkness'.

encyclopedia.content: 来自美国加州，原名Josh Davis的DJ Shadow，在过去的10于年间，发行过２０张单曲即３张专辑，身为DJ与音乐人双重身份的DJ Shadow，不断的创作出极具指标性及开创性音乐作品，96年所发行的【Endtroducing】更是被许多乐迷奉为经典。

entry.def: A shadow is a dark shape on a surface that is made when something stands between a light and the surface.

example.ex: An oak tree cast its shadow over a tiny round pool...
example.tran: 一棵橡树的影子投射在一洼圆形的小水池上。

example.ex: Nothing would grow in the shadow of the grey wall...
example.tran: 灰墙的背阴处什么东西也长不出来。

entry.def: Shadow is darkness in a place caused by something preventing light from reaching it.

example.ex: Most of the lake was in shadow.
example.tran: 湖面的大部分都处在背阴中。

entry.def: If something shadows a thing or place, it covers it with a shadow.
If someone shadows you, they follow you very closely wherever you go.

example.ex: The supporters are being shadowed by a large and highly visible body of police.
example.tran: 拥护者们被大队警察明目张胆地跟踪。

entry.def: A British Member of Parliament who is a member of the shadow cabinet or who is a shadow cabinet minister belongs to the main opposition party and takes a special interest in matters which are the responsibility of a particular government minister.
If you say that something is true without a shadow of a doubt or without a shadow of doubt, you are emphasizing that there is no doubt at all that it is true.

example.ex: It was without a shadow of a doubt the best we've played.
example.tran: 毫无疑问这是我们表现最出彩的一次。

entry.tran: 在…的阴影之下;在…的光环下（显得逊色)
entry.def: If you live in the shadow of someone or in their shadow, their achievements and abilities are so great that you are not noticed or valued.

example.ex: He has always lived in the shadow of his brother.
example.tran: 他一直活在他哥哥的影子中。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a shadow of their former self, you mean that they are much less strong or capable than they used to be.

example.ex: Johnson returned to the track after his ban but was a shadow of his former self.
example.tran: 约翰逊在禁赛结束后又回到了跑道上，但已找不回当初的状态。

means.word_mean: 5. an indication that something has been present;

sentences.sentence: "there wasn't a trace of evidence for the claim"
"he felt secure in his father's shadow"
"he received little recognition working in the shadow of his father"

means.word_mean: 8. a spy employed to follow someone and report their movements

sentences.sentence: "the poor child was his mother's shadow"

means.word_mean: 1. follow, usually without the person's knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "This year's debt dwarves that of last year"

auth_sentence.content: They are a shadow of their own old self.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are a shadow of their own old self.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are a shadow of their own old self.

auth_sentence.content: Our TV set...was receiving triple and quadruple shadow images.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our TV set...was receiving triple and quadruple shadow images.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our TV set...was receiving triple and quadruple shadow images.

auth_sentence.content: That shadow falling, like a leaf spiralling down.
auth_sentence.res_content: That shadow falling, like a leaf spiralling down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That shadow falling, like a leaf spiralling down.

sentences.en: So dark are the shadows that a man standing there could not be seen.
sentences.cn: 阴影很暗, 人站在里面不会被看见。

sentences.en: Her face was in deep shadow.
sentences.cn: 她的脸部在一片很暗的阴影中。

sentences.en: The tree casts a shadow on the ground.

means.word_mean: 阴暗部分；昏暗处；背光处；阴暗处

sentences.en: He walked along in the shadows hoping no one would recognize him.
sentences.cn: 他走在暗处, 希望没有人认出他来。

means.word_mean: 虚幻的事物, 失去实质的事物，不可能得到的东西

sentences.en: He spent his life chasing after shadows.
sentences.cn: 他用毕生精力追求不存在的东西。
我的女朋友与我形影不离。

means.word_mean: 少许, 微量，些微，一丁点

sentences.en: I have not the slightest shadow of doubt about that.
sentences.cn: 我对那件事没有丝毫的怀疑。

sentences.en: The grass is shadowed by huge oaks.
sentences.cn: 草被巨大的橡树所遮蔽。

sentences.en: Our planes shadowed the enemy fighter.
sentences.cn: 我们的飞机一直跟踪着敌人的那架战斗机。

jushi.english: The earth's shadow sometimes falls on the moon.
jushi.chinese: 地球的影子有时落在月球上面。

jushi.english: He walked along in the shadows hoping no one would recognize him.
jushi.chinese: 他走在暗处,希望没有人认出他来。

jushi.english: The invalid was worn to a shadow.
